column1: Dhamangaon is a city and a municipal council in Amravati district in the state of Maharashtra
column2: India. Dhamangaon is one of the three talukas (Other two are Chandur Railway and Nandgaon Khandeshwar) in Chandur (Railway) subdivision in Amravati district. The municipal council is named as Dattapur-Dhamangaon Municipal council.

column1: Dhamangaon has a tropical climate with hot
column2: dry summers and mild to cool winters. Summer lasts from March to June
column3: monsoon season from July to October and winter from November to March. The warmest month is May. About 979 mm of precipitation falls annually.

column1: Dattapur-Dhamangaon is a Municipal Council is the local authority in the city. The Dattapur-Dhamangaon city is divided into 17 wards for which elections are held every 5 years.

column1: Dhamangaon is well connected by road and trains to other important cities. Dhamangaon railway station is a railway station serving Dhamangaon town
column2: in Amravati district of Maharashtra State of India. It is under Nagpur railway division of Central Railway Zone of Indian Railways. It is located on Howrah–Nagpur–Mumbai line of the Indian Railways. As of 2016
column3: electrified double Broad Gauge railway line exist and at this station
column4: 40 trains stops. Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar International Airport (Nagpur)
